net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.busy

Interface BusySession

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeReadId<String>, Stoppable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBusyManager.BusySessionImpl

    public interface BusySession
extends AttributeReadId<String>, Stoppable
    This is the interface for a busy session. It represents a session during which the application client is busy. After the logic making the client busy is performed this BusySession has to be stopped.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getId()
      This method gets the ID used to identify this object.
      boolean isStopped() 
      void stop()
      This method stops this busy session.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        This method gets the ID used to identify this object. An ID should be unique.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadId<String>
        Returns:
        the object's ID.
        See Also:
        BusyManager.start(String)

      • stop

        void stop()
        This method stops this busy session. It should be called exactly once. Additional invocations of this method on the same BusySession may log a warning but have no further effect. If the top-level BusySession is stopped, the application client changes from busy back to idle.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Stoppable

      • isStopped

        boolean isStopped()
        Returns:
        true if this BusySession has already been stopped.
